vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σάρδιον, τό,
the Sardian stone, [NT+5th c.BC+]; as a seal, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; σάρδια, of female ornaments, [Refs 5th c.BC+]—This stone was of two kinds, the transparent-red or female being our carnelian, the transparent-brown or male our sardine, [Refs 4th c.BC+]:—later λίθος σάρδιος, [Refs 6th c.AD+] in “de An.” 321.10 (plural); σάρδινος λ., [Refs]; σαρδόνιον, [Refs 5th c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
carnelian (a reddish precious stone) gem
carnelian, a reddish precious stone, Rev. 4:3; 21:20*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: cornalina (una piedra semipreciosa, usualmente de color rojo)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
一種紅色的寶石, 有兩類, 前者因其肉色澤, 故稱為"肉紅玉髓" (carnelian),
後者稱為"肉紅石髓" (sard) (啟 21:20)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
一种红色的宝石, 有两类, 前者因其肉色泽, 故称为"肉红玉髓" (carnelian),
后者称为"肉红石髓" (sard) (启 21:20)
